content: pattern bunny lovey materials ● ww yarn - 4 weight parts & pieces ● f 3 75mm hook i use clover brand ● polyfil fiber stuffing ● stitch marker ● small amount of embroidery thread black & pink ● optional 12mm safety eyes notes 1 difficulty level beginner 2 using recommended tools and materials bunny head measures approximately 12 inches around ears are approximately 5 5 inches long arms are approximately 4 25 inches long 3 please read pattern all the way through before beginning © once upon a hook crochet 4 small parts and pieces are not meant for designer victoria stewart small children if making this item for a ​ small child please consider embroidering eyes in place of safety eyes 5 these instructions are for the head ears and arms only you are welcome to attach these pieces to your blanket of choice i have included a list of specific materials as well as the blanket pattern used on the last page stitches used ● single_crochet single_crochet ● single_crochet increase single_crochet increase ● single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease ● magic_ring mc ● repeat instructions x times you will want to insert - or - embroider your eyes at this point eyes are placed between rounds 17-18 head round 23 single_crochet decrease x 1 single_crochet x 8 x 4 single_crochet x 1 work in the round do not slip_stitch to join ​ 37 round 1 mc single_crochet x 6 into ring 6 ​ round 24 single_crochet x 5 single_crochet decrease x 1 x 5 single_crochet x 2 ​ round 2 single_crochet increase x 6 12 32 ​ round 3 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 1 x 5 single_crochet increase x 2 begin stuffing head continue stuffing as you ​ 19 go round 4 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 2 x 5 single_crochet x 4 24 round 25 single_crochet decrease x 1 single_crochet x 3 x 6 single_crochet x 2 ​ ​ 26 round 5 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 3 x 6 30 ​ round 26 single_crochet x 1 single_crochet decrease x 1 single_crochet x 1 x 6 single_crochet round 6 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 4 x 5 single_crochet x 5 35 ​ ​ x 2 20 round 7 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 5 x 5 single_crochet x 5 40 ​ round 27 single_crochet decrease x 1 single_crochet x 1 x 6 single_crochet x 2 ​ round 8 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 9 x 4 44 ​ 14 round 9 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 10 x 4 48 ​ round 28 single_crochet decrease x 7 7 ​ round 10 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 15 x 3 51 ​ finish off by weaving a long end through round 11 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 16 x 3 54 your last round and cinching close leave ​ remaining length for attaching head to round 12 single_crochet increase x 1 single_crochet x 26 x 2 56 ​ blanket
